meta.notes: High level amateur right-handed golfer with right eye dominance and good athletic build, swinging a mid-iron.

summary.headline: Solid fundamentally sound mid-iron swing with small opportunities to clean up transition and low point control.
bullets: Athletic, balanced setup that supports a powerful coil.
Good wrist hinge and width in the backswing.
Clubface control is generally very good through impact.
Transition timing can get a touch upper-body dominant.
Low point control can tighten up for more compression.

strengths: Athletic setup with clean spine tilt and balance.
Solid connection between arms and body in the takeaway.
Good wrist hinge that creates width and leverage.
Clubface control is generally stable through impact.
Finish is balanced with full rotation toward the target.

priorityFixes.title: Clean up transition timing
priorityFixes.detail: Start the downswing from the ground up: lead foot pressure, then hips, then torso, then arms. This will sharpen low point and contact.

priorityFixes.title: Shallow the downswing a touch
priorityFixes.detail: Feel the club falling slightly behind you at P5–P6 instead of straight down. This reduces steepness and helps compress the ball.

priorityFixes.title: Keep pivot centered through impact
priorityFixes.detail: Avoid sliding or backing away at impact. Stay centered and rotate so low point is in front of the ball more often.

powerLeaks: Upper body wants to start the downswing before the lower body.
Slight casting in the transition when you go after it hard.
Early extension under max effort swings.
Downswing can get a fraction steep, costing you smash factor.

checkpoints.label: Setup
checkpoints.note: Balanced, athletic posture with clean alignments.

checkpoints.label: Shaft parallel backswing
checkpoints.note: Clubhead tracks nicely along the target line with good face control.

checkpoints.label: Lead arm parallel backswing
checkpoints.note: Good width and depth with plenty of rotation and coil potential.

checkpoints.label: Top of swing
checkpoints.note: Plenty of turn with a playable club position at the top.

checkpoints.label: Lead arm parallel downswing
checkpoints.note: Club is close to on-plane but can get just a touch steep under pressure.

checkpoints.label: Shaft parallel downswing
checkpoints.note: Face and path are playable but a fraction steep, which can steal compression.

checkpoints.label: Impact
checkpoints.note: Clubface is generally square with decent shaft lean and compression.

checkpoints.label: Trail arm parallel follow-through
checkpoints.note: Arms and body are synced with a clean extension toward the target.

checkpoints.label: Finish
checkpoints.note: Balanced, full finish with chest facing the target and weight left.

practicePlan.overview: Next 14 days: lock in transition, shallow the downswing slightly, and keep the great fundamentals you already own.

days.label: DAYS 1–2: Setup & Alignment
days.focus: Start from a repeatable blueprint every time.
days.detail: 10–15 minutes per session on mirror checks and alignment rods. Build a pre-shot routine that hits posture, ball position, and aim.

days.label: DAYS 3–5: Transition Timing
days.focus: Lower body starts, upper body follows.
days.detail: Step drills and pause-at-top swings to rehearse the correct sequence. Film 3–5 swings each day to confirm feel vs. real.

days.label: DAYS 6–7: Shallow Downswing
days.focus: Get the club coming in from the slot.
days.detail: Use an external tee or headcover just outside the ball line. Hit 40–60 balls focusing only on path and contact.

days.label: DAYS 8–10: Low Point Control
days.focus: Move the strike consistently in front of the ball.
days.detail: Paint a line on the turf or mat and train divots to start just ahead of it. Track how often you hit the correct side.

days.label: DAYS 11–14: Full Swing Integration
days.focus: Blend the new feels into normal speed.
days.detail: Play random-shot practice: different clubs, different targets, full routine. Track contact quality and start line.
